meanings.definition: A long white radish with a mild flavor.
meanings.sent1: I added some crunchy mooli to my salad for extra freshness.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a bunch of mooli from the field.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit tried to juggle the slippery mooli.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the kitchen as she compared the mooli to a magic wand.
meanings.sent5: The mooli looked like a ghostly finger reaching out from the soil.

meanings.definition: The edible root of a plant in the mustard family.
meanings.sent1: Grandma used mooli to make a delicious pickle.
meanings.sent2: The chef grated the mooli to add a zesty kick to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the mooli was a secret treasure map.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the simmering mooli filled the kitchen with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The crunch of the mooli was like biting into a fresh cloud.
